author: PFCal-dev
body:
#### PR description:

Following PR #26811, this development allows to simulate an end-of-life scenario for Silicon sensors as well. In particular:

- the computation of charge collection efficiency and leakage current makes use of a parametrized fluence map from fluka
- an `HGCalRadiationMap` class is developed with specializations for Si and Sci sectors
- proper treatment of the noise components is added together with the implementation of the gain switch mechanism for the HGCROC
- standalone analyzers are added/updated to allow simple testing of each feature

This set of changes will allow to study the evolution of occupancy and bandwidth for an end-of-life configuration of the HGC silicon and scintillator sectors.

#### PR validation:

the changes included in this PR have been presented and discussed at the HGCal DPG [here](https://indico.cern.ch/event/827633/contributions/3463807/attachments/1861038/3058615/20190612_deguio_HGCalElectronicsSimulation.pdf) and [here](https://indico.cern.ch/event/832849/contributions/3492966/attachments/1878035/3095136/20190709_deguio_HGCalElectronicsSimulation.pdf)

the performance isn't expected to change for the standard non-aged scenario:
- [HGCDigitizer::finalizeEvent - plain 11_0_0_pre2 - non-aged](http://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/HGCalDigi/Jul15/outputAlgo2_0_geom.11_0_0_pre2.pp/18)
- [HGCDigitizer::finalizeEvent - plain 11_0_0_pre4+thisPR - non-aged](http://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/HGCalDigi/Jul15/outputAlgo2_0_geom.a0e819999d9/18)

while for the aged scenario most of the slow down comes from `HGCalDDDConstants::locateCell` or math operations:
- [HGCDigitizer::finalizeEvent - plain 11_0_0_pre4+thisPR - aged](http://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/HGCalDigi/Jul15/outputAlgo2_3000_geom.a0e819999d9/18)

@pfs @rovere @cseez
title: Improvements to the HGC digitizer and implementation of a end-of-life scenario for the HGC silicon sector
